Introduction : We have tried to make an recreational game "CHAIN-REACTION" using the concepts that we got to learn from "CS 101" course.
	       We used 'OpenGL' graphics package with glut.
	       This is a strategy game for 2 to 4 players.
	       With the help of mouseclick the game can be played.
	       The game contais 8*6 grid with a limit to maximun number of balls placed in the cell.
	       The objective of Chain Reaction is to take control of the board by eliminating your opponents' balls.
	       For more instructions about the game, click on 'INSTRUCTIONS' button in main screen.
 	       You can press 'ESC' key on keyboard anytime to exit the game.



System requirements : This is designed for windows 8/8.1 OS(32 or 64 bit) (not tasted on mac and linux)



Installation : It runs on codeblocks with included libraries(opengl with glut).
	       Get Full Version of Codeblocks from "http://www.cse.iitb.ac.in/~ranade/simplecpp/CB-Simplecpp-setup.exe"



Configuration : To get 'glut' library go to "http://www.deannicholls.co.uk/site/files/glut.zip".
	        It downloads a zip file containing 3 files.(glut.h ; glut.32.dll and libglut32.a)
   	        Copy glut.dll into your 'C:\Windows\System32' folder (If you're using Windows 7 64-bit, you'll need to copy this file into 'C:\Windows\sysWOW64').
      	        Copy glut.h into the ‘include\GL’ folder in the MinGW compiler folder. If you installed CodeBlocks and MinGW to the default directory , this folder                     will be 'C:\Program Files\CodeBlocks\MinGW\include\GL'.
  	        Copy libglut32.a into the 'MinGW\lib' folder. If you installed CodeBlocks and MinGW to the default directory in Step 3, this folder will be 'C:\Program                 Files\CodeBlocks\MinGW\lib'.

	        Now go to 'settings > Compiler and debugger' and add libraries "opengl32" ; "glu32" and "glut32" to 'linker settings' 
	        If you have any problem visit "http://deannicholls.co.uk/tutorials/show/cpp_glut"



Compile and Runing program : Open the file located in 'source' with codeblocks.
			     Click 'compile' button or 'Ctrl + f9' to compile the code.
			     Click 'run' button or 'Ctrl+f10' to run the code.
			     Alternatively you can click 'compile & run' or 'f9' to do both at once.
